dialogue: < The iPad too, your Eminence. >
Anche l'iPad, Eminenza.
Where is he?
Will you take these upstairs for me?
Me li porta di sopra, per favore?
No, no, I’ll deal with it.
Janusz?
She is safe with me, Your Eminence. I am dealing with the situation.
I am sure you are Sister Agnes. But I must see her myself.
I hardly think a dropped tray should concern the Dean of the College of Cardinals
Even so...
The welfare of the Sister is my responsibility, Dean.
And this Conclave is mine. Beat.
Please, sit, my child. My name is Cardinal Lawrence. How are you feeling?
She’s feeling much better.
Could you tell me your name?
Her name is Shanumi.
Please, do sit down.
Eminence, I really do think it would be better if...
Would you be so good as to leave us now, S ister Agnes?

Sister Shanumi, I want you to understand, first of all, that you are not in any sort of trouble. The fact of the matter is, I have a responsibility before God to make sure that the decisions we make here are the right ones. Now it’s important that you tell me anything that is in your heart and that is troubling you in so far as it relates to Cardinal Adeyemi. Can you do that for me.
Even if I give you absolute assurance that it will go no further than this room?
Would you like me to hear your confession?
Sister Shanumi is on her way home to Nigeria. There was a flight to Lagos this evening. I thought it was best for everyone if she was on it.
How did Sister Shanumi come to be in Rome?
Then you can ask them afterwards.
The information is of value to me now.

I know you were close to the late Pope. When I tried to resign as dean, the Holy Father wouldn’t let me. I didn’t understand why at the time. But now I think I understand. I think he knew he was dying and for some reason he wanted me to run this Conclave. And that is what I’m trying to do. For him.
Your Eminence, a word if I may?
I’ll do that for you, Your Eminence.
How many copies do you require?
One hundred and eight.
